description: The Government of Romania, through the Authority for the Digitization of Romania, and the non-governmental organization Code for Romania launched the online platform COVID-19 Official News (stirioficiale.ro) on Monday, 16.03.2020. The aim of this platform is to fight misinformation and fake news in order to rebuild trust with the state. The site only publishes reliable sources such as press releases from the Romanian government
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 9th, Romania announced that all schools would be closed until March 22nd. On March 16, the Education Minister announced that schools would remain closed until after Easter Break (which ends on April 21).

description:
On April 27th 2020, Romanian President Klaus Iohannis stated in a press release by the National Liberal Party that schools would remain closed for most students until the end of the school year- June 12th 2020. Online learning would continue for these students.

Students in the 8th and 12th grades could come into school from the period of June 2nd to June 12th to prepare for national exams for high school and university. Class sizes were restricted to a maximum of 10 students, and they would only be at school for 3 hours a day, maximum. Exams would continue with social distancing measures observed.
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Romania imposed a curfew starting on the 21st of March 2020. 
In the time interval 22.00 - 06.00, the movement of persons outside the household is allowed only for medical purposes, work, acquiring goods to cover basic needs- including those of pets, caring for a child/elderly person, short physical activity trips including walking pets.

In order to verify the reason for traveling in the professional interest, the persons are obliged to present, at the request of the competent authorities staff, the service card, the certificate issued by the employer or a declaration on their own responsibility or a declaration on their own responsibility, completed in advance.

The declaration on one's own responsibility must include the name and surname, date of birth, residential address/ place of professional activity, reason for travel, date of completion and signature.

The exceptions to these provisions are the personnel within the Presidential Administration, the Romanian Parliament, the Romanian Government, the Public Ministry, the institutions of the national defense system, public order and national security, the diplomatic corps and the personnel providing public utility services.

 UPDATE: The curfew was lifted on May 15th 2020
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Military,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On March 24, 2020, Romania imposed a curfew on all over 65-year-olds, who are only allowed to leave home between 11:00am and 1:00pm for medical treatments, providing goods that cover the basic needs of persons and pets, and moving for justified reasons, such as caring for a minor, assisting other elderly, sick or disabled people, or in case of death of a family member.
 UPDATE: On April 27, 2020, Romania  imposed a curfew on all over 65-year-olds, who are only allowed to leave home between 7:00am and 11:00am, and 7:00pm and 10:00pm for provision of goods that cover the basic needs of persons and pets, and for justified reasons, such as caring for a minor, assisting other elderly, sick or disabled people, or in case of death of a family member. Travel for medical treatments, professional activities, and agricultural purposes are allowed irrespective of the time slots.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

Travel for medical treatment, professional activities, and agricultural purposes are allowed irrespective of the time slots.

description: Romania declared a state of emergency on March 16th.
Romania's President announced an extension to the state of emergency, that has been in place since March 16th.

On 14 May 2020, the National Committee for Emergency Situation issued Decision no. 24 approving the state of alert on national level, as well as specific measures for controlling and preventing the spread of COVID-19.

description: From the 19th of June 2020, the Ministry of Transport, Infrastructure and Communications in Romania is launching an application in which travellers entering Henri Coanda Airport, Bucharest have to fill out a questionnaire. This includes contact details and residence of isolation- if necessary. Travellers must then isolate for 10 days. This is targeted towards people travelling from areas of high epidemiological risk, but not to those with similar or less infection rates than Romania. After 10 days of quarantine, travellers are free to leave isolation.
type_sub_cat: A snapshot of a person’s health at a given point in time

description: On the 21st of January 2020, the Technical-Scientific Support Group for the Management of Highly Contagious Diseases in Romania decided with the Ministry of Internal Affairs to order 1,750,000 protective resources, including PPE, single use gloves and protective masks. They also allocated 110 isolation rooms with negative pressure, 200 cardio respirator machines- 3 sets for the 57 emergency hospitals plus 9 Regional Centres of Infectious diseases, and 2 reserves. They also ordered 150 sets of filters for the isolated rooms, 9000 litres of disinfectant TP1, 9000 litres of TP 2, 5,100 kg of disinfectant for semicritical surfaces, and 5,100 kg of disinfectant for noncritical surfaces.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Romania empowered the Center for Medical-Military Scientific
Research, the Center for CBRN (Chemical, Biological, Radiological and Scientific), Scientific Research for Defense and Ecology, the Agency for  Research of Military Technique and Technologies and the National Institute for Medical-Military Research and Development "Cantacuzino" to   to approve/authorize medical materials, components, equipment and devices necessary for the prevention and control of the spread, as well as for the treatment of the infection with the SARS-CoV-2 virus, and also
biocides.
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
On April 4, Romania established a quarantine in the city of Tandarei, with entry and exit banned except for the transport of goods and essential personnel. 
On 11 May, an eleventh Military Ordinance lifted the Țăndărei quarantine UPDATE: On 11 May, an eleventh Military Ordinance lifted the Țăndărei quaratine

description: Romania issued a military ordinance, to enforce a lockdown, as all citizens were forbidden from traveling outside of their homes unless it is for professional purposes or the purchase of essential goods (with several other smaller exceptions). UPDATE: from May 15th, citizens could leave their homes but only travel within their localities. UPDATE: From May 15th 2020, Romania went from a state of emergency to a state of alert, and self-declaration forms will no longer be needed to leave the house
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: All medical alerts, press releases, texts, photo/video/audio materials of public interests and public service announcements were to be broadcast free of charge in advertising slots.

description: Romania is enforcing a two-week quarantine on all passengers, including Romanian nationals arriving from or having visited the Hubei region, 11 localities in Italy and the Diamond Princess Cruise Ship.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Romania is enforcing a two-week quarantine on people coming from China-Hubei Province (including Wuhan City), Wenzhou, Hangzhou, Ningbo, Taizhou in Zhejiang Province or from one of the 12 localities in Italy are quarantined for 14 days in specially designated areas.

People from other provinces / cities in mainland China and other localities in the Lombardy and Veneto Regions enter self-isolation at home, for 14 days, immediately after returning to Romania.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: From 11th August 2020, travellers from Spain will be placed in a 14 day quarantine in Romania. The place of quarantine will either be the person's home, at a location declared by him or, as the case may be, in a special space designated by the authorities. Quarantine is recommended to all people who live at the same address.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From the 12th of March 2020 in Romania, private companies with more than 99 employees are recommended to reschedule their working hours, starting at 8:00am, 9:00am or 10:00am. The aim is to avoid traffic and public transport congestion.

description: From May 15th 2020 in Romania, private businesses/ economic operators are obliged to ensure that employers can work from home. If the work can not be performed from home then employers must not allow the access of the persons whose body temperature, measured at the entrance to the enclosure exceeds 37.3 degrees. Employers must enforce mandatory disinfection of hands before entering work spaces, and disinfection of surfaces.
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: From the 9th of March 2020, in order to prevent the spread of COVID-19 in Romania, the ministries with their own sanitary network and the local public administration authorities shall provide hotel spaces intended for rest between shifts for the staff of the public sanitary system, three meals a day and water.

institution_status: This service provided by the government is provided with no conditions attached

description:
public authorities  institutions and all public and private operators are obliged to organise their activitys o as allow for work to be performed from home; where the activity cannot be carried out in a “work from home” structure, entities must implement measures to ensure:epidemiologic triage through temperature control for own personnel and visitors; disinfection of hands before entering workspaces;
observance of rules related to conduct of work in open spaces.

description: Starting with June 1st 2020 in Romania, the access of people on the beaches is allowed only with the mandatory provision of sunbeds for each of the persons present, ensuring a minimum distance of 2 m between the sunbeds for people in different families.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_status: This service provided by the government is provided with conditions attached
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In Romania from the 17th of June 2020, the state of alert was extended for 30 days. Measures concerning regulation of government services to increase response capacity during the state of alert were introduced including: operational coordination of public ambulance services and voluntary services, operational cooperation of the local police, and ensuring measures for the continuity of elderly and residential centres for children and adults, with or without disabilities.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Romania banned all mass gatherings of over 100 people from the 11th March 2020 until the 31st of March 2020, with the possibility of prolonging. This includes gatherings for sport, religious, scientific or leisure events. Indoor spaces such as theatres and cinemas were closed, but not shopping malls. 

This decision was announced by the head of the Department of Emergency Situations (DSU), Raed Arafat and Health Minister Nelu Tataru.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Romania banned all mass gatherings of over 100 people from the 11th March 2020 until the 31st of March 2020, with the possibility of prolonging. This includes gatherings for sport, religious, scientific or leisure events. Indoor spaces such as theatres and cinemas were closed, but not shopping malls. 

This decision was announced by the head of the Department of Emergency Situations (DSU), Raed Arafat and Health Minister Nelu Tataru.

On March 14th 2020, gatherings of more than 50 people were banned. UPDATE: The original policy restricted gatherings up to 100 people. The new policy restricts gatherings up to 50.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Romania banned all gatherings of more than 3 people not living together from March 22nd 2020. 
From June 15th 2020, gatherings of up to 6 people not living together was allowed. 
 UPDATE: The restrictions of gatherings for up to 3 people in public has been relaxed to 6 people.

public meetings, concerts or other meetings in open spaces, as well as all cultural, scientific, artistic, sport, entertainment, gambling, fitness, swimming etc performed in closed spaces continue to be prohibited (except for certain activities, including: religious gatherings, personal care treatments in dedicated areas, training for professional athletes, certain cultural activities and recreational/sports activities such as cycling, hiking, running, swimming, mountain climbing, hunting, fishing and similar – the latter with the participation of not more than 3 individuals who do not live together)
type_sub_cat: Cancellation of a recreational or commercial event
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From June 1st 2020 in Romania, it is allowed to organize and conduct shows, concerts, other outdoor cultural events, as well as public and private festivals, with the participation of up to 500 spectators with seats at a distance from minimum 2 meters, relative to each other, wearing a protective mask.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Military,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)
